Posts.Content: Sep 9, 2011 10:41AM Eluned wrote: I have the same type of cell growth in my left breast.  Never has it shown up on a mammo only on MRI.  I have also been told I'm never going to be screened with a mammo again.  Only MRI because of dense tissue and the new issues.  I have another coming up in Oct/Novemeber (to see if it has changed in the last 6 months) and then will likely opt to have it taken out for further and complete testing.  Just to make sure.
Posts.Title: atypia cells keep growing back - what to do? kingjr66 kingjr66

Posts.Content: Eluned wrote: I was just wondering what sort, if any, experience anyone has had with having surgery to remove Flat epithelial atypia (which also has multiple papillomatos)? I've been referred to a surgeon at the end of the month and I'm just trying to be as informed as possible of the different options that may have been encountered (and experiences with the surgery itself would be great). Many thanks, Eluned Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Surgery for Flat Epithelial Atypia and Papillomatosis Eluned Eluned

Posts.Content: Aug 11, 2011 09:24AM Eluned wrote: Thanks!  The long winded saga is information, and the more I have the better I feel.  The papillomatosis that I have are not near the nipple and I actually haven't had any symptoms related to it as it is deep in dense tissue.  So far only my left breast is causing me grief.  I had a normal mammogram in Dec. 2010 and was referred (as a low priority) for an MRI because of dense tissue.  It was the MRI that picked up the tissue that is suspect.  The MRI graded it as birads 4B.
Posts.Title: Surgery for Flat Epithelial Atypia and Papillomatosis Eluned Eluned
